main event: An unidentified bright light was observed in Detroit, Mich., on 9-8-59, by ground radar and visual sighting. The object moved in a straight line and then appeared to cross paths.
interesting points: Observation by both ground radar and visual sighting indicates the credibility of the report.
The object was described as bullet-shaped with a body four times as long as it was wide, with tail fins protruding above and below the body.
No trail or exhaust was observed, and no sound was heard from the object.
The observer was looking at the moon through a telescope when the object passed in front of the moon, visible for approximately two seconds each night.
The sighting occurred around the time of a successful moon shot by USAR, prompting speculation that the public's increased scrutiny of the moon may have resulted in more UFO sightings.
photographs: no photographs or any other physical evidence exist
